creator: luyi@psa.com.sg
text:
I call the java task with fork="true", and <jvmarg value="-Xms64m -Xmx384m"/>.
But java process exit with error message:
Invalid initial heap size: -Xms64m -Xmx384m
Could not create the Java virtual machine.

My java task looks like:
    <java classname="${APP_MAINCLASS}" fork="true" output="test.log" 
append="true"> 
      <jvmarg value="-Xms64m -Xmx384m"/>
      <sysproperty key="java.security.auth.login.config" 
value="${CITOS_ROOT}/common/dist/config/CITOS_JAAS.properties"/>
      <classpath>
        <path refid="FullClasspath"/>  
      </classpath>
    </java>

You should use <jvmarg line="...."/>
or
<jvarg value="-Xms64m"/>
<jvarg value="-Xms384m/>

 for
multiple arguments
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
luyi@psa.com.sg
text:
Tried to use separate jvmarg.  But now get this error:
Error occurred during initialization of VM
Incompatible initial and maximum heap sizes specified

My java task now look like:
    <java classname="${APP_MAINCLASS}" fork="true" output="test.log" 
append="true"> 
      <jvmarg value="-Xms64m"/>
      <jvmarg value="-Xms384m"/>
      <sysproperty key="java.security.auth.login.config" 
value="${CITOS_ROOT}/common/dist/config/CITOS_JAAS.properties"/>

creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
Sorry, my example had a typo
it should have read
<jvarg value="-Xms64m"/>
<jvarg value="-Xmx384m/>
